summary: The Health Out-of-Pocket Expense Act of 2025 (HOPE Act) amends the Internal Revenue Code to establish HOPE Accounts. These accounts are tax-advantaged savings accounts designed to pay for qualified medical expenses for eligible individuals. The bill defines eligible individuals, qualified medical expenses, contribution limits, and tax treatment of distributions.  It also addresses employer contributions to these accounts, reporting requirements, and penalties for non-compliance. The effective date is for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
